fields.description: As a user i would like to choose the procol of the remote when cloning from hosted projects
fields.summary: choose between protocols when cloning a hosted project

fields.description: I edit some files, switch to SourceTree and refresh but the Discard button in the toolbar is still disabled. If I stage and then unstage the file, the Discard button becomes enabled. If I then edit the file to remove the changes, switch back to SourceTree and refresh, the file disappears from the Working Copy Changes list but the Discard button is still enabled.
fields.summary: Discard enabled/disabled state doesn't update correctly

fields.description:
When I use the Merge button from the toolbar, it's harder than it should be to find the branch I want to merge in the log view.

Merges are most likely going to be from refs, i.e. branches and tags. A log view is not a good way to find those refs. A list of branches and tags would be better. Maybe the log view could be shown when a "Select Commit" button is clicked instead?

Additionally, defaulting the log view to current or all branches based on the setting of the log view in the main window is not useful. Why would you want to merge a commit from your current branch? All Branches seems to be the only logical choice here.
fields.summary: Make it easier to find branches/tags in Merge dialog

fields.description: When merging a branch I would like to be able to choose whether it is done fast-forward (if possible) or non-fast-forward. I.e. the equivalent of the -ff-only and --no-ff commandline options. I prefer the result of my merges to be predictable.
fields.summary: Offer ff-only/no-ff options for merge

fields.description: When merging a branch, non-fast-forward, from the right-click menu, I would like to be able to edit the commit message.
fields.summary: Allow editing merge commit message

fields.description:
How to replicate:
While doing the commits, create a new branch and merge it back again to default. Do some changes, which are detected as uncommitted files. The Source Tree allowed me to switch branches with uncommitted changes. When I selected the develop branch, the application incorrectly colored the part of the main default branch as well.

Expected behavior:
Develop branch should have its color only to the point where it was branched out from the default branch.

Observed behavior:
Develop branch has part of the default branch colored, it looks like the default branch was branched out of the develop branch, which is incorrect.

Note:
BitBucket branches are colored as expected. The develop branch looks like it is branched out of default branch, which is expected. More info and discussion can be found on Stack Overflow:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/22590485/source-tree-branches-are-not-colored-correctly/22612784
fields.summary: Incorrect branch coloring for Source Tree Mercurial repo

fields.description:
steps to reproduce:

1) make sure develop is ahead of default
2) create a feature branch
3) make some changes, don't commit
4) release that these changes should have been a hotfix, so you "shelve" the changes vs. commit them
5) verify there are no uncommitted changes, verify shelf contains changes
6) switch to default branch
7) create hgflow/hotfix
8) unshelf changes to hotfix
9) check uncommitted changes

#9 includes MORE than what was present in hotfix.  It appears it's including everything that's a diff between default and feature-branch, not just the shelf itself.  I've reproduced the same using TortoiseHG and everything functions as designed so it appears to only happen in SourceTree.

I often use shelf feature to fix situations where I meant to create a hotfix vs. a feature or vise versa.  On average my default branch is behind a week or two from any develop feature branch.
fields.summary: creating shelves for feature branch, unshelfing to new hotfix includes entire feature branch not just shelved changes

fields.description:
when creating a hg-flow feature, you get some weird issues if the name has symbols or spaces:

- If you include slashes, the tree renders things incorrectly.  It appears to nest  by word based.  

- if you include a pound, I'm unable to complete feature.  I'm forced to close branch manually and merge manually.

- I don't remember specifics but I recall having issues with spaces in my hg-flow/feature.

Overall I view these as minor bugs -- most of the time I don't really mean to create a feature with spaces, slashes or # in them so if the new feature UI could simply mask via regex I think it'll prevent most if not all of these.
fields.summary: hg-flow/new feature with symbols or spaces in name

fields.description: The checkbox could remember the check state so the user does not have to recheck each time.
fields.summary: Apply stash window does not remember the "Delete after applying" checkbox state

fields.description: Source tree crashes on rebase continue. Version 1.5.1004.0. Logs attached.
fields.summary: Crashes on rebase continue

fields.description:
After installing SourceTree and loading the tutorial repository from BitBucket, I cannot commit changes. Git returns the error message "*** Please tell me who you are." I have checked the check box under Tools->Options->General tab: "Allow SourceTree to modify your global Git and Mercurial config files" and entered my name and email address. Intuitively, the information should be passed to Git.

I have installed the versions of Git and Mercurial internal to SourceTree and I suspect this to be the cause of the error.
fields.summary: Option "Allow SourceTree to modify .. config files" has no effect

fields.description:
When editing hosting account when you click "Why?" button while having the username blank produces an empty error message.

Could be a feature (cause you know - it's obvious), but I thought I'd report it anyway.
fields.summary: Edit Hosting Account - Empty error message

fields.description:
I really like SourceTree and it works a charm to see the different commits.
What I really have trouble though is that it's extremely difficult to follow a project with many committers merging and merging again on the same branch.
What I really would prefer is, that the leftmost (or alternatively otherwise marked like bold, color, ..) branch marker in the graph is always the 'master' on the server because that is actually what interests me most - to see what state was at any time pushed on the public server.
fields.summary: Better marking of current branch

fields.description: Working with a clone of https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/isis.git (also mirrored at https://github.com/apache/isis/)
fields.summary: crashed just after doing a push; .log attached

fields.description: Launched SourceTree clone from Stash. Edited the path to clone2, and also changed the name of the bookmark from the default (which was probably the trigger, since it's the only thing different from my previous clones). SourceTree crashed at the beginning of the clone process.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed when starting to clone

fields.description:
When I'm on a a branch I don't see other detached heads. Let's say I have a repo. I have three commits: foo, bar and baz

I go back and checkout foo, make a new change, and commit (newbie). 

If I look in sourcetree I will see in the graph the original tree and my new tree.

If I then checkout the master the "other" head it will be missing in sourcetree. I would want to see it so I can merge that other tree with the master (note that while on the other tree I would not want to merge master back in because that would be a different thing.

I have included a zip of the example. The "other" detached head is 39d2295

checkout 39d2295 and you will see master
checkout master and you will not see, nor can you do anything with 39d2295
fields.summary: Not all detached head trees viewable in graph

fields.description:
When a user selects a repository to delete on disk, SourceTree prompts to commit files that have been modified or are untracked. However, it does not prompt the user to push those commits. 

If there are commits that need to be pushed, there is no prompt. The repositories are deleted from the disk.

It would be nice to have SourceTree prompting the user to push those commits before deleting the repository on disk otherwise they will be lost.
fields.summary: Prompt User to Push Commits Before Deleting Repositories on Disk

fields.description: Would it be possible to put some kind of drop down and per project settings for user name?  I have multiple user names for Git, and I seem to always have trouble changing the current "user".  A drop down on top would be awesome showing the current user you are making changes as.
fields.summary: Username Management

fields.description:
If you have done a merge and you end up with a situation like:

{code}
deleted by them:    jira-admin-helper-plugin/pom.xml
{code}

To me it's not really obvious that it's not a plain text conflict, although I guess that the diff window is all grey is a clue.

However just through muscle memory I do Launch External Merge tool, and I get the "Visual Merge in Progress" dialog. However that just sits there forever, and I can see that Beyond Compare is not started at all.

If it's not appropriate to launch the merge tool then that option should not be enabled... or it should tell you when you click it.

BTW, I have only tested this with Beyond Compare, but don't think it's specific to the merge tool.
fields.summary: launch external merge tool doesn't work with a conflict "deleted by them"
Crash when commiting the root repository after adding a submodule

fields.description: When using SourceTree for Windows the Remote Branches should auto-sync and remain updated when a branch is deleted from Stash.  Currently I have to run a command via the Terminal in order to force the syncing process.  Ex: "GIT remote prune origin".
fields.summary: Remote branches do not remain in sync with STASH

fields.description: In SourceTree/Git, and maybe other versions, it would be really helpful to see the history of one specific branch without having to check it out. We have a lot of branches, and some of them take several minutes to check out. It's too hard to find anything when you view all branches at once.
fields.summary: Show history for one branch without checking it out

fields.description:
Maybe that is not a critical bug and that is by design, but it's extremely frustrating for a not so experienced Git user to find local repos deleted without a notice.

I have a root folder "Bitbucket" with my repos in subfolders: "repo1" and "repo2". I've added 3rd repo "repo3", but by mistake not in a subfolder but in a root folder "Bitbucket". When I noticed that I decided to remove an empty repo from the disk and recreate it in a subfolder. That is how my "repo1" and "repo2" were silently deleted with "repo3" as they were subfolders of the "repo3".

In my case that was not a problem as repos were in sync with Bitbucket, but if they were not I could say goodbye to my work as the deleted repos are not moved to the Recycle Bin and you can't restore them.
fields.summary: Deletion of local repos

fields.description:
I'm noticing that the Fetch button doesn't work or seesm to be delayed somehow.

However, if I run `git fetch --all` from the terminal it works.

I'm no sure if it matters but:
- I have only 1 remote called `origin`. 
- I'm using https repo url and authentication tab has my credentials.
- I have check remotes for update set to every `2` minutes
- Pull/Push command buttons work as expected.
fields.summary: Fetch does not work or is delayed.

fields.description: It would be good if we can categorize bookmarks. At the moment, I have so many repositories in SourceTree that it is getting hard to view them. Having them categorize will help in sorting them out.
fields.summary: Categorize repository bookmarks

fields.description:
SourceTree does not prune remote branches when "fetch all tags" is selected using the fetch button.

When i deselect "fetch all tags" the remote branches which are deleted on the remote server are deleted.
fields.summary: SourceTree does not prune remote branches when "fetch all tags" is selected

{code}
fields.summary: Crash while opening the Branches section for a repo

fields.description: The lastest release of Stash has some git flow features, however, Stash adds a branch called bugfix that isn't in the original git flow. It would be nice to add that as an option in the git flow feature of Sourcetree to "Start a bugfix."
fields.summary: GitFlow change

fields.description:
"Hosted Repositories" window does not populate the list of public/private repositories.
STR:
1. Open the "Hosted Repositories" window
2. Fill in the login/password for Bitbuket repository host
3. Click OK
4. After the automatic refresh the list of repositories is empty
fields.summary: Hosted repositories do not work correctly

fields.description:
With the "Log / History" view displayed I switch to a branch (one file change).  The "Switch Branch" blue progress bar displays for about 3 seconds with 30-40% CPU.  When the progress bar finishes, the top half of the windows displays "Loading..." for about 6-12 seconds, and 3 or 4 instances of the "git.exe" process are shown in Windows Task Manager, each using 22-24% CPU, with a total CPU of 100%.  The top half of the window finishes loading, the instances of git.exe all end a few seconds later, and CPU usage returns to 2-10%.

On the "File Status" tab the filter is set to "Show Modified".  There are no untracked files.  The performance slowdown seems to be the same if I use embedded GIT (v 1.8.3) or the system GIT (v 1.8.4).

Is the problem with GIT or SourceTree?
fields.summary: 100% CPU (git.exe) when loading the Log/History view
crash at start in win 8

fields.description: SOCKS is not HTTP(S), so SourceTree must neither assume it should use an HTTP proxy nor that there is no proxy just because HTTP proxy is unspecified. When using system defaults and those defaults contain a SOCKS proxy, SourceTree should be able to use it. The user should be able to manually specify a SOCKS proxy, but using system defaults and respecting the non-proxy list would be even better. It works with HTTP(S), just not with SOCKS.
fields.summary: Support for SOCKS Connections

fields.description: I cloned a project from a remote repo with the show progress enabled. When the clone was complete I clicked on the close button and the application crashed.
fields.summary: Crash when closing window after cloning a project

fields.description:
In Tools > Options > Git menu check the 'Display author date instead of commit date in log' option.

In the Log/History view the author date is displayed.
However, change to the Search view and perform a search.
Note that the date shown in the grid is the commit date rather than the author date.
fields.summary: Display author date instead of commit date in log not respected in Search view

fields.description:
Currently if I want to change the remote branch my local branch is tracking I can right-click the branch and choose Track Remote Branch in the context menu.

This simply opens a scrollable list of all remote branches, which is very difficult to navigate if there are a large number of remote branches.
Navigation by key press is not supported, so the only option available is to scroll the list.

It would be much better if a search window could be opened to provide an easy way to find the desired remote branch.
fields.summary: Provide a better user interface to track remote branch.

fields.description: If you double-click on the right border of the "Graph" heading, it minimizes the graph column in the display (as expected and appropriate).  If you double-click it again, the graph display is redrawn overlapping the Description text.  (See attached images.)
fields.summary: Graph display overlaps text display

fields.description:
Message during HG checkin:

warning: bitbucket.org certificate with fingerprint 24:9c:45:8b:9c:aa:ba:55:4e:01:6d:58:ff:e4:28:7d:2a:14:ae:3b not verified (check hostfingerprints or web.cacerts config setting)

This is a default install, and such an install should have security configured correctly out of the box.
fields.summary: Certificates are not checked with a Default installation of StrTreeWin

fields.description:
When old branches have been deleted on the remote, the local working repository still lists them unless I go to the command line and type:  {{git remote prune origin}}.

This could be added to the remote context menu.  See attached.
fields.summary: Add prune as an option to the remote context menu

fields.description: I had just focused SourceTree and was scrolling down to look at a remote.
fields.summary: Crash Log

fields.description:
After upgrading to 1.4.1 I am unable to add any Mercurial working copy repo to SourceTree. After selecting the working copy folder, the message below the path edit box just says "This is not valid working copy path", even though it is a valid Hg repo.

Any repos that had already been added were inaccessible as double clicking on the bookmark did nothing, so you cannot viewn the commit graph, or do anything with the repo.
fields.summary: Unable to add working copy Mercurial repo - Error: This is not valid working copy path
Crashed. While checking remote master branch

fields.description:
I really like the way SourceTree is evolving. The only real blocker for me now is that I have my private repos primarily at KilnHg.com (mostly with clones on BitBucket, of course). The repos are tied to Fogbugz cases which is why Kiln is my primary host.

Could you please add Kiln to the collection of Hosted Repos?
fields.summary: Please add support for Kiln in Hosted Repositories

fields.description:
This is a really really minor thing. But it still annoys me everyday a tiny little bit, which is why I am reporting it now.

SourceTree shows a folder icon for branches with at least one "/" in it. This is great, because it can help structuring your branches, when you think of e.g. Windows folders and files. However, the folders and files (branches) are strictly sorted alphabetically on the same level (see attached Picture). Imho the folders should be grouped and sorted afterwards. This would feel way more natural. Or at least way more like the details view of the Windows Explorer with folders and files.
fields.summary: Group Branches before sorting them alphabetically

fields.description: It would be nice to have an option to auto wrap text in diff views. This would be a great feature for everyone who uses SourceTree as a revision control system for his text files like articles, theses etc. Otherwise you have to scroll horizontally if your line (sentence) is to long for your diff view.
fields.summary: word wrap for diff views

fields.description:
The german translation of SourceTree for Windows is incomplete.

For detailed informtion see the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Missing german translations in options pane

fields.description:
I track tens of repositories. When I reinstall the computer or move to a new machine, I have to add them manually one by one. 

Would it be possible to save the currently tracked repositories and on import to download them?
fields.summary: Backup of the current tracked repositories and settings

fields.description: Wrong text vertical align in commit list if tag/branch name present. In this situation description text is about 2 px out. See image.
fields.summary: Wrong text vertical align in commit list if tag/branch name present

fields.description: I can't get information, push or commit anything with SourceTree. It opens up alot of Resources, but it hapends nothing.
fields.summary: Can't push or commit, and it's starts alot of GIT prg on my computer

fields.description:
Make the width of all open tab the same. 

The width may depends on amount of tabs, but have to be the same for all tabs in any moment of time.

It will improve the tab manipulations with mouse.
fields.summary: Same tab width

fields.description: Now to select the project and open/switch to the project tab I need to double click on the project. Add the option to do it by single click.
fields.summary: Open tab on single mouse click

fields.description:
Allow sorting bookmarks on Windows alphabetically.

It seems this was implemented on Sourcetree for Mac in SRCTREE-838 - looking for the same feature on Windows.
fields.summary: Allow sorting bookmarks on Windows alphabetically

fields.description: I always have to force the working copy to refresh. It will not show my changes  automatically. I either have to hit the settings button on the top right and then press OK or hit fetch and it will then update the working copy with changes I have made. this also means it doesn't show an 'uncommited changes' commit and the repo info on the far left indicates it is clean even though I have made changes to my files.
fields.summary: Working copy will not autorefresh

fields.description: When I go to resolve files a lock file is then created, after that it doesn't allow me to continue and gives me a message saying another file is creating a lock on my files, which means it won't resolve my files. I have no other GIT applications running, only SourceTree
fields.summary: Can not resolve files because of lock

fields.description: When I use the Ctrl-1/2/3 shortcuts to switch between the File Status, Log/History and Search tabs, the keyboard focus switches to and remains on the tabs themselves. For a better user experience, the keyboard focus should remain in the main view for each tab.
fields.summary: Keyboard focus remains on File Status tab after using Ctrl-1 shortcut

fields.description:
Sourcetree will order it's graph by the date of commit/author only. It will ignore the parent/child context.

In my example
- 1.1 is the root of the branch
- 1.1.1.1 is child of 1.1
- 1.1.1.2 is child of 1.1.1.1
- ...
- 1.1 and 1.1.1.1 do have the same commit timestamp

GitExtensions order is correct
SourceTree order is wrong
fields.summary: Graph order incorrect

fields.description:
When adding a submodule to a Git repository (via SourceTree menu option 'Add submodule'), I am forced to use a full URL to the repository. Git supports the use of relative URLs however, so when my submodule is on the same host (e.g. Bitbucket), I can refer to it as a submodule, via a URL like '../otherproject.git'.

Using relative URLs, when using HTTPS, will not include the username in the URL, and make the submodule available to use for other users of the repository. (the context menu to change the source URL of a subrepository does however allow me to change it into a relative URL, so SourceTree blocks this only when adding a new submodule).

When pulling the repository (which has these relative submodules), via HTTPS, SourceTree does not recognize these URLs either, as it is prompting me to enter the password (for my Bitbucket account) for each of the submodules. SourceTree doesn't recognize the host names for the submodule repositories.

This is also causing the git-remote-https.exe process to hang for devs who are pulling from the repository, after a new submodule has been added. Killing this process, and re-pull, is now the only way to get it to work.

Obviously these issues mainly arrise when using Git via HTTPS. When using SSH the need for using relative URLs is lower (as there is no username in the URL), and the authentication does not rely on a cached password.
fields.summary: Add proper support for relative URLs when creating a Git submodule
ReachingOut

fields.description: I always want to see what's happening in GIT, so I always check the 'show full output' option. It would be nice that you could set an option, that it is checked by default.
fields.summary: Add option to select 'show full output'

fields.description: I've noticed at times SourceTree doesn't seem to reflect the latest state of our GIT repository.  I clearly see a revision when looking at the repository through  the Stash web interface, but it doesn't appear in my Source Tree GUI (and I don't get any "revisions behind" number on my Pull button).  I tried manually refreshing several times, and closed and re-opened Source Tree, but the changes still weren't appearing.  Clicking Pull will still bring these changes down, and THEN they show up correctly in the history view.
fields.summary: Source Tree doesn't always refresh with latest state of GIT repository

fields.description:
I have configured my remote's push refspec for remote 'user' to push to refs/users/myusername/heads/* such that `git push user` sends my modification to my userspace on my gerrit server.

It all works well from the command line, but SourceTree doesn't let me use the default push refspec. It always overrides the target branch with a value, doesn't let me push without a defined target branch and makes it increadibly hard for me to actually find out what it actually does.

A solution is obviously a custom button but SourceTree should really honor the push refspec config.
fields.summary: Push refspec not honored

fields.description: Just closed the Remotes / Origin node in my repository tree...
fields.summary: Crash

fields.description: In one of our git repos, there are about 8k tags sharing prefix followed by a slash like so: Build/1.00, Build/1.01, etc.  When Source Tree for windows opens the repo, these tags are collapsed into a folder and the program works fine.  Expand the folder and the program will lock up.  It comes back to life eventually but will continue to lock up periodically as long as that folder is expanded.
fields.summary: Source Tree performs poorly with about 8k tags nested in a folder.

fields.description:
Add an "options" menu entry, allowing to set the GUI colours.
In particular, allow to set a black background colour (much better for someone's eyes).
fields.summary: Allow to set a black background color

fields.description: Application crashed when accessing remote branches in the treeview.
fields.summary: Application crashed when accessing remote branches in the treeview

fields.description:
SourceTree is set to check default remotes for updates every 10 min. Although this works most of the time, occasionally we noticed that there are updates on the remote (confirmed from the terminal), but SourceTree shows no updates to pull. We tried to refresh manually the remote status, but still no updates are shown to be pulled.
Closing SourceTree and killing the git.exe processes, then restarting SourceTree resolves the issue.
The local Git is 1.8.5.2 for Windows, the remote is 1.8.3 on Ubuntu Server 13.10.
The remote repository is on the LAN, so the networking can be ruled out as a cause.
fields.summary: SourceTree occasionally does not refresh remote status

fields.description:
when I copied a URL for cloning in Source Tree, it is stated under Repository Type that "This is not a valid source path/URL", but when I click "details", nothing is displayed in the pop-up. I am very certain that the URL I used is a valid one because it is a URL provided by our instructor at a coding class and everyone else managed to use it alright. (The URL I used was: https://github.com/code61/learning_html.git)  I have tried reinstalling Source Tree and have also downloaded GitHub, but problem persists. 

I have attached a screenshot of the problem. 
It will be greatly appreciated if you could help me to solve this problem.
fields.summary: Invalid URL

fields.description:
I have ubuntu installed on vmware on my local machine.
I have shared my /var/www folder with Samba.
In windows 8x64 i have mapped the shared folder to letter W:.
When i have a git repository open in sourcetree ( W:\project1\ )
and inside the guest (ubuntu) do a "chmod g+rwx \var\www" (or g-rwx), sourcetree crashes.
fields.summary: Crash when chmodding git repository

fields.description: When i have file in UTF-8, special (for example Czech) characters are corrupted (in preview) WHEN there is some content before them. I send you one precise example for this. Sometimes it is ok, when data BEFORE special chars are another length, sometimes it got messed. I wanted migrate my project to GIT and found this strange behaviour. See screenshots attached, it is illustrating the problem. I wanted to make the minimal example when problem occurs, so this is it.. Josef
fields.summary: Preview encoding bug

fields.description: When using the Flow components within SourceTree, it doesn't appear to be possible to use accents (say, ó, á, etc) when naming features, etc. The app doesn't return any error, it just closes the window but doesn't add any new branch.
fields.summary: Flow & Mercurial: Trying to create new features/releases/hotfixes with descriptions that include accents doesn't work.

fields.description:
I am getting either blank dialogs or crashes in SourceTree when trying to access many of the menu options.

It might be related to WindowBlinds, as the behavior is different depending on whether or not I set WB to not skin SourceTree.

If I don't set it to not skin SourceTree, going to Tools -> Options causes the program to crash.

If I do set it to not skin SourceTree, going to Tools -> Options results in a blank dialog.

I also got blank dialogs related to registration and help upon first launching the program, but somehow managed to click in the right spots to import the license.

Note: The "sourcetree.log" file is the one generated while running the program with WindowBlinds skinning enabled. The "sourcetree-noskin.log" is the one generated when running the program with WB skinning disabled. The attached screenshot also shows the behavior of the app with WindowBlinds skinning disabled.

Note that I am re-filing this because my original request, which was labeled as support but later changed to bug, has gotten absolutely no response from anyone after 5+ days. I am hoping that filing it as a bug initially will actually get a response.

*Work Around*

Taken from the comments below.

* Go into the compatibility settings for the program (right-click -> Properties, click the Compatibility tab) and check the "Run this program as an administrator" box, the problems go away. 
* I now have to tell Windows that I want to allow the program to make changes to my computer each time I run it, but that's something I can live with if it means having a working program (there's no way to tell Windows to remember the option for each program apparently, or at least not with the default settings).
fields.summary: Blank Dialogs or Crashing

fields.description: I have configured several git hook scripts to use with my repository. Running the git command that triggers them from the console (for instance, "git commit -m 'MESSAGE'" properly triggers the post-commit script), but executing the same command via SourceTree's interface (in this example using the Commit button) does not do so.
fields.summary: Git Hooks

fields.description:
Can you add the DateTime of the commit on the blame screen on SourceTree. The date and time of the commit is not currently displayed on the blame screen, making it difficult to know what changes were made recently.

Also (side note/new feature suggestion) it would be nice to group the lines (alternating colors) by commit. So instead of alternating colors for each line, alternate by the commits so its easier to see which groups of lines where commit together.
fields.summary: Can you add the DateTime of the commit on the blame screen on SourceTree

fields.description: I have my external diff (and merge) configured for Beyond Compare, which used to work flawlessly (albeit a bit slowly) but now it does nothing.
fields.summary: Beyond Compare external diff no longer functions

fields.description:
SourceTree for Win was working, was using kiln with it. Running in a vmware Fusion VM on OS X Mountain Lion.

Today, I was suddenly unable to start it up.
fields.summary: Cannot start SRCTREEWIN

fields.description:
I noticed that source tree is not taking into account case changes in a file name. SourceTree regards them as the same file and unchanged. This can cause an issue in development environments where file names are case sensitive.

For instance 'jquery.js' to 'jQuery.js'.

It can be unexpected behavior of the app when local files and repo files are technically different because the of upper/lower case difference.
fields.summary: File name case changes ignored

fields.description:
In the attached repository, where two branches both change a single file. Attempt to merge and elect to keep the changes from my branch/"Keep mine"/Discard. The merge commit will disappear from the commit history. Pressing commit in SourceTree still shows the appropriate commit message, but there is no indication that a commit is needed.

$ git status
# On branch B
# All conflicts fixed but you are still merging.
#   (use "git commit" to conclude merge)
#
nothing to commit, working directory clean
fields.summary: Merge commits that contain no changes do not show up as uncommitted.

fields.description: The username utilized for cloning from Hosted Accounts List is incorrect.  I believe it should be using git@bitbucket.org right?
fields.summary: Hosted account list: wrong username utilized for bitbucket clone

fields.description: Graph view needs updating and some simplification. Just compare this two screenshots. Gitk vs SourceTree on same git repository. I think that it's understandable about what I say.
fields.summary: Commit graph needs updating

fields.description:
There should be a place to view all files and directory structure with a possibility to right click on a file and display log or blame. It could be another tab after Search tab.

Something like this is available in bitbucket under the Source tab.
fields.summary: File tree tab to browse project

fields.description:
Currently it's unable to prevent SourceTree from checking for updates.
In our corporate environment our IT wants to prevent automatic updates.
Could it be possible to add an option parameter controlling the update and the update cycle?
fields.summary: Make update check optional

fields.description:
One think to prevent us from using SourceTree as the default tool within our company is the requirement for retriving a license.

While the license itself is obsolet, why can't you just remove this extincted requirement?
fields.summary: Remove need to obtain a valid license

fields.description:
I'm using SourceTree with git as a frontend for an svn repository. I configured SourceTree to use the system-installed git version which is of version 1.8.5.2 (so not too far ahead of the embedded git Version).
Trying to create a branch 'testbranch_3' with SourceTree at first succeeds (the branch seems to have been created) but results in a fatal error when trying to checkout that branch. From the log:

{noformat}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false checkout -b testbranch_3_local --track testbranch_3
fatal: Cannot setup tracking information; starting point 'testbranch_3' is not a branch.
{noformat}

Apparantly the problem is the {{--track}} option which has been removed at some point: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/19712735/git-svn-cannot-setup-tracking-information-starting-point-is-not-a-branch
fields.summary: create and checkout branch in svn via git-svn does not work with git 1.8.5.2

fields.description:
Often (or always) when I commit several files, the commit button will not perform commit and close the dialog right away. It will disable after clicking and then get enabled again due to slow and ongoing refresh of the files that are staged for commit. It seems to work better if I instantly click the commit button after the first time it comes back to enabled state again.

The refreshing process is still going on by the time I am ready to commit. And the commit button will disable/enable during this time since it is working in intervals.

# Stage several files
# Put commit message and press commit while the refreshing is still in process
# Click the commit button when it is enabled between refresh
# *the dialog will not close, instead the button will go back to enabled after the next refresh*
fields.summary: Commit button is not committing instantly
Chinese translation errors

fields.description:
I am getting either blank dialogs or crashes in SourceTree when trying to access many of the menu options.

It might be related to WindowBlinds, as the behavior is different depending on whether or not I set WB to not skin SourceTree.

If I don't set it to not skin SourceTree, going to Tools -> Options causes the program to crash.

If I do set it to not skin SourceTree, going to Tools -> Options results in a blank dialog.

I also got blank dialogs related to registration and help upon first launching the program, but somehow managed to click in the right spots to import the license.

Note: The "sourcetree.log" file is the one generated while running the program with WindowBlinds skinning enabled. The "sourcetree-noskin.log" is the one generated when running the program with WB skinning disabled. The attached screenshot also shows the behavior of the app with WindowBlinds skinning disabled.
fields.summary: Blank Dialogs or Crashing
Crash after adding mercurial submodule, when the module is already checked out

fields.description:
Hi

In our develop environment, there are some test PC which shared among development team members. sometimes engineers need to login into these test PC with a common user account to access specific test resource (for example, debugging on target board). In such a case, we don't want sourcetree on these shared machines to remember the user authentication.

Please help to implement this feature for us.
fields.summary: add option to do not remember user authentication

fields.description:
When a co-worker create a branch, but after the braching, the other co-worker push his commit which is dated before the branch.

Graph in SourceTree does not show this merge/branch correctly.

My commit just before branching should be shown on both branch, but it only appears on the new branch only.

This is in-consistent to the graph on bitbucket web .
fields.summary: Graph is wrong

fields.description:
In my company _\*.cpp_ and _\*.h_ files are in CP1251 encoding but all other files in UTF8. If I change default encoding in SourceTree options then all non-ASCII commit messages are broken.
I think this issue can be resolved via _[.gitattributes encoding option|https://www.kernel.org/pub/software/scm/git/docs/gitattributes.html#_tt_encoding_tt]_  per project like this:
{code:title=.gitattributes|borderStyle=solid}
*.cpp  encoding=cp1251
*.h  encoding=cp1251
{code}
I wish SourceTree has support for this option.
fields.summary: Make SourceTree use .gitattributes "encoding" option for diff view

fields.description:
Sourcetree has performed phenomenally for me so far, but I've noticed a case where the application can slow down to a near crawl.

Our office has two networks: One for connecting to the company domain and another for high bandwidth.  Since our company's domain network is slow, I tend to stay connected to the high bandwidth network.  However, if my computer starts connected to the company domain network, I am automatically granted access to some very slow network drives.

Note I do not have any repositories stored on the network drives.

If Windows does not detect the slow network drives (started computer on high bandwidth network), Sourcetree runs spectacularly.

If Windows has access to the slow network drives (started computer on company domain network), Sourcetree sees a significant, but still workable slowdown.

If Windows detects the slow network drives but no longer has access (started computer on company domain network then switched to high bandwidth network), Sourcetree slows to a crawl and individual components see various delays.  A diff of a file may pop up before the staging area has refreshed.  It may take half a minute for a small repo to open.  If I then manually disconnect from the network drives, performance is restored.

I assume this has to do with the way Sourcetree or Windows scans the file system.  The mere presence of a missing or slow drive is enough to grind work to a near halt.  It is not so much an issue for me, but it is a performance issue.  Is this a flaw in Windows or could Sourcetree exclude looking at drives that have no repository?
fields.summary: Sourcetree slows down when slow network drives are merely present
Error While Cloning Empty Repository from Stash

fields.description:
I'm really appreciate for the great tool, SourceTree, for windows.

but I have some difficulty or problem while using SourceTree graph section.

Actually I'm a colorblind, especially between green and red.
So, I cannot recognize the separate lines, dots on the graph easily .

if there something like shape(rectangle, triangle, start), dotted line, doubble line.. I can recognize and I will understand the graph more easily.

More than 1 percent of humans are color blind. :)
fields.summary: improve graph recognition (about color?line?)

fields.description: When a branch is tracking a remote branch and we merge from a DIFFERENT remote the tracking is updated to this new remote. It would be nice to have an option to disable this kind of behavior.
fields.summary: Option to not update tracker when merging

fields.description:
May I request a way to configure SourceTree-Win so that double clicking on a file in the "staged changes/working copy changes pane" opens External Diff rather than opening the file.

When clicking through files on that pane, because the lines are so close together, I am continually mistakenly double-clicking one line instead of selecting the next line. Given the files I am generally inspecting, usually this means a new copy of Visual Studio starts up which I then have to close. This is a major inconvenience with my SourceTree usage.

But if double clicking opened my External Diff, that would not be an inconvenience, as it would support my review workflow.
fields.summary: Request double-click file to open External Diff not "Open File"

fields.description:
When you go to Repository Settings => Advanced, there is an option to override global user settings.
The settings that are being displayed are the default git credentials, not the ones from Mercurial.

Also: When you change the settings without including email, nothing is saved (no warning either).
fields.summary: Mercurial: Repository user information shows git credentials

fields.description: Install completes and SourceTree crashes on every start/restart. Pageant.exe, plink.exe and puttygen.exe are missing in 'C:\Program Files\Atlassian\SourceTree\tools\putty'. Putting those programs in place resolves the issue. The install removes those programs but does not replace them.
fields.summary: Update breaks SourceTree startup
Incorrect location to author map file saved in .git/config

fields.description:
using git flow when working on a large feature we often need to work on sub-features. i.e. branch out of a feature branch to something and then merge back to the feature branch.

I am now working on a large feature and i want to move some of the work to a colleague. my colleague has to branch out of my branch, do more work and then merge back to my branch. they cannot merge back to dev as the feature is not complete
fields.summary: Support for sub-features

fields.description:
I'm using SourceTree git-svn feature to clone a Subversion repository which is not a huge repository (SVN working copy is 19MB with ~4000 revisions).
The command itself seems to be working well.

Typically, git-svn output may be very detailed and long
and it looks that SourceTree output pane has problem with such long content. This makes the SourceTree seriously choke.
Unchecking "Show Full Output" does not seem to help as the content is accumulated in background anyway.

I'd suggest a switch that would allow users to disable detailed output,
just preserve initial command and final message with completion status.
fields.summary: Show Full Output makes the application choke

fields.description:
It would be nice to show the remote configuration dialog automatically (or at least a button for that) to the push screen if there are currently no remotes configured.

This would make the workflow for creating a new repository a lot easier (especially for new users). Currently one has to use the context menu via Repository -> Add Remote to add a remote to a new repository (unless the repository has been cloned from an upstream server already).
fields.summary: Show a remote setup dialog when using the "Push"-Button while no remotes are configured
